body: Hello everyone, my name is Mateo I'm from Argentina and I wanted to make this post to talk about the moderators (or rank), I have a couple of questions. How can you become a moderator (or other rank)? How are moderators chosen? Sorry if I'm wrong about something I do not know much English.
body_tagged: Hello everyone, my name is Mateo I'm from Argentina and I wanted to make this post to talk about the moderators (or rank), I have a couple of questions. How can you become a moderator (or other rank)? How are moderators chosen? Sorry if I'm wrong about something I do not know much English.
title: Moderators (or ranks)

replies.body:
You don't necessarily  need "good english," but being fluent in the language would help you communicate more with the community, staff, and overall server.
Not to mention that the main player base speaks English, as well as the whole website being written in English. Of course, there are quite a few Spanish-speaking members, but I'm afraid if you have to resort to Google Translate to speak, it might be a bit hard on you.

If you think becoming moderator is too hard, you are definitely encouraged to continue playing on Avicus, and with the community!

(Sorry if you can't understand this, I don't speak Spanish myself.)

replies.body:
He can use google traslator during interview! :P (I don't think so, but, who knows?!)
If they can understand and he sounds like a good person, why he doesn't will be accepted!

You have high chances, my loved friend. Mate, you will be accepted! But, for now, continue being an Avicus player and enjoy Avicus.

Be moderator has too much responsibilities, think four times before apply.

  Good luck!

replies.body:
We require you to be able to write a fluent application, do an interview, and be able to speak English fluently in game.

This is because English is by far the most dominant language on Avicus, and you need to be able to communicate with others.
replies.body_tagged:
We require you to be able to write a fluent application, do an interview, and be able to speak English fluently in game.

This is because English is by far the most dominant language on Avicus, and you need to be able to communicate with others.

replies.body: Yes being able to speak English fluently is required, but being bilingual would be a major bonus!
replies.body_tagged: Yes being able to speak English fluently is required, but being bilingual would be a major bonus!

reply_to.body:
We require you to be able to write a fluent application, do an interview, and be able to speak English fluently in game.

This is because English is by far the most dominant language on Avicus, and you need to be able to communicate with others.

replies.body:
1) Study English and attempt to become a mod
2) Don't study English and just play on the server, have a good time
3) Find a Spanish language server that you enjoy and become a moderator  and/or play there
